items.creator: Scott Neuman
items.title: Police Viewed Less Favorably, But Few Want To 'Defund' Them, Survey Finds
items.content:encoded:
A poll conducted in mid-June found that most respondents thought police officers should be held legally accountable for misconduct. But few respondents favored cutting funding for law enforcement.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu/AP)
items.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
items.content: A poll conducted in mid-June found that most respondents thought police officers should be held legally accountable for misconduct. But few respondents favored cutting funding for law enforcement.
items.contentSnippet: A poll conducted in mid-June found that most respondents thought police officers should be held legally accountable for misconduct. But few respondents favored cutting funding for law enforcement.

items.creator: Scott Neuman
items.title: Bolivian President Tests Positive For Coronavirus
items.content:encoded:
The announcement from the country's interim president, Jeanine Áñez, comes just days after Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro announced that he had contracted COVID-19.

(Image credit: Aizar Raldes/AFP via Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
items.content: The announcement from the country's interim president, Jeanine Áñez, comes just days after Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro announced that he had contracted COVID-19.
items.contentSnippet: The announcement from the country's interim president, Jeanine Áñez, comes just days after Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro announced that he had contracted COVID-19.

items.creator: Austin Horn
items.title: Starbucks Says Customers Must Wear Masks At Its Cafes
items.content:encoded:
Several states already require people to wear masks in public spaces like coffee shops to slow the spread of the coronavirus, but many still have no such requirement.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg via Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Austin Horn
items.content: Several states already require people to wear masks in public spaces like coffee shops to slow the spread of the coronavirus, but many still have no such requirement.
items.contentSnippet: Several states already require people to wear masks in public spaces like coffee shops to slow the spread of the coronavirus, but many still have no such requirement.

items.creator: Laurel Wamsley
items.title: Supreme Court Rules That About Half Of Oklahoma Is Native American Land
items.content:encoded:
"Today we are asked whether the land these treaties promised remains an Indian reservation. ... Because Congress has not said otherwise, we hold the government to its word," wrote Justice Gorsuch.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Laurel Wamsley
items.content: "Today we are asked whether the land these treaties promised remains an Indian reservation. ... Because Congress has not said otherwise, we hold the government to its word," wrote Justice Gorsuch.
items.contentSnippet: "Today we are asked whether the land these treaties promised remains an Indian reservation. ... Because Congress has not said otherwise, we hold the government to its word," wrote Justice Gorsuch.

items.creator: Scott Neuman
items.title: Death Of Robert Fuller, Who Was Found Hanging From Tree, Ruled Suicide
items.content:encoded:
Fuller's death on June 10 was initially ruled a suicide, but that conclusion outraged his family, who insisted that he would not take his own life.

(Image credit: Kyle Grillot/AFP via Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Scott Neuman
items.content: Fuller's death on June 10 was initially ruled a suicide, but that conclusion outraged his family, who insisted that he would not take his own life.
items.contentSnippet: Fuller's death on June 10 was initially ruled a suicide, but that conclusion outraged his family, who insisted that he would not take his own life.

items.creator: Pien Huang
items.title: WHO: Aerosolized Particles Unlikely To Be Significant Source Of COVID-19 Transmission
items.content:encoded:
After 239 scientists raised concerns about transmission by aerosolized particles, the World Health Organization has issued a brief on the role of aerosolized particles — and called for more research.

(Image credit: NIAID)
items.dc:creator: Pien Huang
items.content: After 239 scientists raised concerns about transmission by aerosolized particles, the World Health Organization has issued a brief on the role of aerosolized particles — and called for more research.
items.contentSnippet: After 239 scientists raised concerns about transmission by aerosolized particles, the World Health Organization has issued a brief on the role of aerosolized particles — and called for more research.

items.creator: Richard Harris
items.title: An Enzyme That Increases With Exercise Can Improve Memory In Mice, And Maybe People
items.content:encoded:
When scientists revved up the production of an enzyme called GPLD1 in older mice, it stimulated nerve growth in their brains and the animals navigated a maze better.

(Image credit: Owen Franken/Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Richard Harris
items.content: When scientists revved up the production of an enzyme called GPLD1 in older mice, it stimulated nerve growth in their brains and the animals navigated a maze better.
items.contentSnippet: When scientists revved up the production of an enzyme called GPLD1 in older mice, it stimulated nerve growth in their brains and the animals navigated a maze better.

items.creator: Austin Horn
items.title: 'Please Scream Inside Your Heart,' Japanese Amusement Park Tells Thrill-Seekers
items.content:encoded:
Several park-goers have complained that the request for those on roller coasters to remain silent is unrealistic. "If a scream comes out, it comes out," one visitor said.

(Image credit: Bloomberg/Bloomberg via Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Austin Horn
items.content: Several park-goers have complained that the request for those on roller coasters to remain silent is unrealistic. "If a scream comes out, it comes out," one visitor said.
items.contentSnippet: Several park-goers have complained that the request for those on roller coasters to remain silent is unrealistic. "If a scream comes out, it comes out," one visitor said.

items.creator: Philip Ewing
items.title: Defense Secretary Esper, In Careful Exchange, Denies Being Briefed On 'Bounties'
items.content:encoded:
The defense secretary and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs respond to careful prompts from Republicans on Thursday aimed at defending the Trump administration on the Russian bounty allegations.

(Image credit: Greg Nash/Pool/Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Philip Ewing
items.content: The defense secretary and the chairman of the Joint Chiefs respond to careful prompts from Republicans on Thursday aimed at defending the Trump administration on the Russian bounty allegations.

items.creator: Bobby Allyn
items.title: Cameo Celebrity App: Will Birthday Wishes From Snoop Dogg Mean A Big Investor Payday?
items.content:encoded:
Cameo has become one of the fastest-growing tech startups by letting anyone pay for birthday wishes and other greetings recorded by celebrities and influencers. But will its Silicon Valley hype last?

(Image credit: Cameo/Screenshot by NPR)
items.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn
items.content: Cameo has become one of the fastest-growing tech startups by letting anyone pay for birthday wishes and other greetings recorded by celebrities and influencers. But will its Silicon Valley hype last?

items.creator: John Ruwitch
items.title: U.S. Sanctions Chinese Officials, Including Politburo Member, For Xinjiang Abuses
items.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's penalties are meant to punish China for its treatment of Uighurs and Muslim minorities in the region, and target a Politburo member for the first time.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein/AP)
items.dc:creator: John Ruwitch
items.content: The Trump administration's penalties are meant to punish China for its treatment of Uighurs and Muslim minorities in the region, and target a Politburo member for the first time.
items.contentSnippet: The Trump administration's penalties are meant to punish China for its treatment of Uighurs and Muslim minorities in the region, and target a Politburo member for the first time.

items.creator: Anthony Kuhn
items.title: Seoul's Mayor Found Dead After Massive Search
items.content:encoded:
Mayor Park Won-soon's daughter told police he left a verbal message similar to a will, and later turned off his mobile phone. His body was found in a wooded park early Friday, police say.

(Image credit: Cheon Jin-hwan/Newsis via AP)
items.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn
items.content: Mayor Park Won-soon's daughter told police he left a verbal message similar to a will, and later turned off his mobile phone. His body was found in a wooded park early Friday, police say.

items.creator: Domenico Montanaro
items.title: You Won't See Trump's Taxes Before Election Day, But He Could Face Bigger Problems
items.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court's decision means President Trump's financial records will likely need to be turned over to a New York grand jury and could imperil his brand and fortune.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro
items.content: The Supreme Court's decision means President Trump's financial records will likely need to be turned over to a New York grand jury and could imperil his brand and fortune.

items.creator: Lauren Frayer
items.title: Black Lives Matter Gets Indians Talking About Skin Lightening And Colorism
items.content:encoded:
The American call for racial justice has led to a heated debate over attitudes about skin tones — and caused some lightening creams, like Fair & Lovely from Unilever, to change their names.

(Image credit: Amit Dave/Reuters)
items.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
items.content: The American call for racial justice has led to a heated debate over attitudes about skin tones — and caused some lightening creams, like Fair & Lovely from Unilever, to change their names.

items.creator: Bill Chappell
items.title: 5 People Arrested In Killing Of Rapper Pop Smoke, LA Police Say
items.content:encoded:
Three men and two juvenile males have been arrested in connection with the rapper's death in February, the Los Angeles Police Department announced.

(Image credit: Claudio Lavenia/Getty Images)
items.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
items.content: Three men and two juvenile males have been arrested in connection with the rapper's death in February, the Los Angeles Police Department announced.
